definition: to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither

sentences.english: The Swedish experiment, to be frank, was a glorious failure.
sentences.chinese: 坦率地說，瑞典的實驗雖敗猶榮。

sentences.english: For the Chinese did not win more sad motherland proud assured.
sentences.chinese: 爲中國沒有獲勝而傷心，更爲祖國的雖敗猶榮而自豪。

sentences.english: When the news of the failure came, all his friends said that it was a victorious defeat.
sentences.chinese: 當失敗的消息傳來，他所有的朋友都說他雖敗猶榮。

definition: to spike the ball (volleyball etc)/to smash (tennis etc)
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
(idiom) to freely air one's views/to be heard far and wide/to attract a lot of attention
spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
